description: Create parallel versions of your code to work safely.

slides.title: What is a Branch? üåø
slides.content:
# Parallel Universes

A branch is a movable pointer to a commit.

It allows you to diverge from the main line of development and continue to do work without messing up the `main` code.

slides.title: The Default Branch
slides.content:
# main / master üè∞

When you initialize a repo, you start on a branch usually called `main` (or traditionally `master`).

This is typically your production-ready code.

slides.title: Creating a Branch
slides.content:
# Spawning üß¨

`git branch feature-login`

This creates a new pointer at the current commit.

It does NOT switch you to that branch yet.

slides.title: Switching Branches
slides.content:
# Teleporting üöÄ

`git switch feature-login` (Modern)

`git checkout feature-login` (Old school)

Updates files in your working directory to match the version stored in that branch.

slides.title: Create & Switch
slides.content:
# Efficiency ‚ö°

Most common command:

`git checkout -b feature-login`

or

`git switch -c feature-login`

Creates the branch AND switches to it immediately.

slides.title: Command Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which command creates a new branch AND switches to it in one go?

slides.title: HEAD
slides.content:
# You Are Here üìç

`HEAD` is a special pointer that points to the local branch you are currently on.

When you commit, HEAD moves forward with the branch.

slides.title: Listing Branches
slides.content:
# Overview üî≠

`git branch`

Lists all local branches. The current one is marked with an asterisk `*`.

slides.title: Deleting Branches
slides.content:
# Cleanup üßπ

Once a feature is merged, you don't need the branch pointer anymore.

`git branch -d feature-login` (Safe delete)
`git branch -D feature-login` (Force delete, even if unmerged).

slides.title: Detached HEAD
slides.content:
# Floating in Space üßë‚ÄçüöÄ

If you checkout a specific commit SHA (`git checkout a1b2c3d`) instead of a branch name, you enter "Detached HEAD" state.

Commits made here belong to no branch and can be lost easily.

slides.title: Branch naming
slides.content:
# Conventions üè∑Ô∏è

- `feature/user-auth`
- `bugfix/login-error`
- `hotfix/typo`
- `experiment/dark-mode`

Use slashes to group branches conceptually.

slides.title: Safety Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which flag forces the deletion of a branch even if it hasn't been merged?

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Branching üåø

Isolate work.

- **main:** Production.
- **branch:** Create pointer.
- **switch/checkout:** Move HEAD.
- **-d / -D:** Delete.

## Next Steps
Combine work with **Merging & Conflicts**!
